properties.headline: NSW Health Vaccination Centre - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK Figtree Drive at Australia Avenue
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip by public transport at transportnsw.info.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Sydney Olympic Park NSW Health Vaccination Centres – transport and parking map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Sydney Olympic Park NSW Health Vaccination Centres – transport and parking map

properties.otherAdvice:
The NSW Health Vaccination Centre in Sydney Olympic Park is located at 1 Figtree Drive. The centre is in operation for those with confirmed appointments only from 8am to 7pm, Monday to Saturday. 

Free parking is available at P3 car park on Sarah Durack Ave for those with vaccination appointments. Follow the signs to navigate the short walk to the centre, alternatively a shuttle bus will run to the centre approximately every 20 minutes.

Allow additional travel time on roads approaching the precinct including Australia Ave, Underwood Rd and Hill Rd, and follow the directions of traffic control and staff on site.

For more information about the COVID-19 Vaccination Program in NSW or to check your eligibility and make a booking, visit the NSW Health website at health.nsw.gov.au/COVID-19.

properties.headline: NSW Health Vaccination Centre - BELMONT Pacific Highway near Floraville Road, Floraville
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip by public transport at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
The NSW Health Vaccination Centre in Belmont is located at the former Bunnings site at 393 Pacific Hwy. The centre is in operation for those with confirmed appointments only from 8am to 6:45pm daily Monday to Friday, and from 8am to 2:45pm on Saturday and Sunday. 

Allow additional travel time on roads approaching the precinct particularly during the morning and evening peak. 

For more information about the COVID-19 Vaccination Program in NSW or to check your eligibility and make a booking, visit the NSW Health website at health.nsw.gov.au/COVID-19.

properties.headline: NSW Health Vaccination Centre - SYDNEY CBD Pitt Street at King Street, Sydney
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip by public transport at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
The NSW Health Vaccination Centre in the Sydney CBD is located at 175 Pitt St and is in operation for those with confirmed appointments only from 8am to 8pm on Monday to Friday, and from 8am to 4pm on Saturday and Sunday. 

Allow additional travel time on roads approaching the precinct particularly during the morning and evening peak. 

For more information about the COVID-19 Vaccination Program in NSW or to check your eligibility and make a booking, visit the NSW Health website at health.nsw.gov.au/COVID-19.

properties.headline: NSW Health Vaccination Centre - MACQUARIE FIELDS Victoria Road at Brooks Street
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip by public transport at transportnsw.info.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Macquarie Fields NSW Health Vaccination Centre - transport and parking map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Macquarie Fields NSW Health Vaccination Centre - transport and parking map

properties.otherAdvice:
The NSW Health Vaccination Centre in Macquarie Fields is located at Glenquarie Town Centre. The centre is in operation for those with confirmed appointments from 8.30am to 6pm daily Monday to Saturday. Parking is available at James Meehan Oval, access via Parliament Road

Allow additional travel time on roads approaching the precinct including Victoria Rd, Canterbury Rd and Harold St, particularly during the morning and evening peak periods.

For more information about the COVID-19 Vaccination Program in NSW or to check your eligibility and make a booking, visit the NSW Health website at health.nsw.gov.au/COVID-19.

properties.headline: NSW Health Vaccination Centre - WOLLONGONG Crown Street at Church Street
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip by public transport at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
The NSW Health Vaccination Centre in Wollongong is located at 163-177 Crown Street. The centre is in operation from 8am to 4:30pm daily, Monday to Sunday.

Allow additional travel time on roads approaching the centre including Crown St, Keira St, Church St and Burelli St, particularly during the morning and evening peak periods.

For more information about the COVID-19 Vaccination Program in NSW or to check your eligibility and make a booking, visit the NSW Health website at health.nsw.gov.au/COVID-19.

properties.headline: Boxing Day sales - Sunday 26 December - SYDNEY CBD Market Street, Castlereagh Street and Pitt Street at Pitt Street Mall
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Boxing Day Sales road closure and special event clearways map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Boxing Day Sales road closure and special event clearways map

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and parking restrictions will be in place around Pitt St Mall for the safety of pedestrians during the Boxing Day Sales.

Road closures from 3am until 7pm

  • Market St between Elizabeth St and Pitt St. 
  • Castlereagh St between King St and Park St.

Road closures from 7am to 7pm 

  • Pitt St between Park St and Market St
  • Market St between Pitt St and George St

Two-way managed access will be available on Castlereagh St from King St and Park St only. No vehicle entry to Pitt St between Park and Market Streets after 7am, vehicles will be permitted to exit from Pitt St driveways southbound towards Park St under managed traffic control.

Special event clearways will be in effect on both sides of the Pitt, Market and Castlereagh Streets from 3am to 7pm. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways will be in effect on both sides of the roads below. Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SYDNEY CBD

FROM 3AM TO 7PM

  • Castlereagh Street between King Street and Park Street
  • Market Street between Elizabeth Street and Pitt Street

FROM 7AM TO 7PM

  • Pitt Street between Park Street and Market Street
  • Market Street between Pitt Street and George Street
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

arrangementElements.html:
SYDNEY CBD 

FROM 3AM TO 7PM

  • Castlereagh Street between King Street and Park Street
  • Market Street between Elizabeth Street and Pitt Street

FROM 7AM TO 7PM

  • Pitt Street between Park Street and Market Street
  • Market Street between Pitt Street and George Street

Two-way vehicle access will be managed on sections of Castlereagh St from King St and Park St during the closure period. No access from Market St. From King St access will be available between 3am and 7pm. From Park St to Market St access will be available between 7.30am and 7pm.

There will be no vehicle entry to driveways, loading docks or car parks on Pitt St between Park and Market Streets after 7am when the road is closed. Vehicles will be permitted to exit from driveways southbound onto Pitt St towards Park St under managed traffic control throughout the day.
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures & Changed access arrangements

roads.mainStreet: Market Street, Castlereagh Street and Pitt Street

properties.otherAdvice:
Clearways will be in place to accommodate extra traffic through Mosman on Boxing Day for the Sydney to Hobart Yacht Race starting from 1pm. 

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on Military Rd between Field Way and Spit Rd (southern side only) from 9am until 6pm. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply even to local residents or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs before parking as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.headline: NYE in Dee Why - Friday 31 December - DEE WHY The Strand between Dee Why Parade AND Oaks Avenue

arrangementAttachments.linkName: NYE road closures and clearways map

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures, clearways and restricted access will be in place as large crowds celebrate New Year’s Eve in Dee Why.

Roads at Dee Why beach will be closed from 4pm to 10pm including Howard Ave between The Strand and Clyde Rd and The Strand between Dee Why RSL Club parking entry and Dee Why Pde. Access will be maintained for residents on Howard Ave only.

Special event clearways will be in effect on the western side of The Strand between Oaks Ave and Dee Why Pde from 12pm midday until 10pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Roads around Manly wharf will close from 5pm to 10:30pm including sections of Belgrave St, Eustace St, Gilbert St, Wentworth St, West Promenade, East and West Esplanade and Victoria Pde.

Local access will be maintained for Victoria Pde and Wentworth St residents.

Special event clearways will also be in place on sections of East and West Esplanade, Belgrave St, Pittwater Rd and West Promenade between 1pm and 10pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.headline: NYE in Dover Heights - Friday 31 December - DOVER HEIGHTS various roads incl Military Road, Blake Street and Hunter Street at Dudley Page Reserve
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip or check transport service changes at transportnsw.info.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: NYE road closure and special event clearways map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: NYE road closure and special event clearways map

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures, clearways and restricted access arrangements will be in place as large crowds are expected to attend New Year’s Eve celebrations in Dover Heights.

Roads around Dudley Page Reserve will close between 6pm and 2am including sections of Portland St, Gilbert St, Blake St, Hunter St, Victory St, and other local roads.

Access for residents will be maintained by NSW Police and Traffic Controllers on-site when safe to do so. Delays are expected as crowds leave the area after the 9pm and midnight fireworks. Residents are advised to avoid trying to enter/exit their properties during these times.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 4pm NYE to 2am NYD on sections of Blake St, Lancaster Rd, Military Rd and Portland St, and from 4pm until 7:30pm NYE on sections of Portland St. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Motorists are reminded that access into various Eastern Suburb peninsulas will be restricted to local residents only from 3pm. In some areas, access is restricted to all vehicle traffic including residents after such time.

arrangementElements.html:
DOVER HEIGHTS

FROM 6PM 31 DECEMBER 2021 TO 2AM 1 JANUARY 2022

  • Blake Street Between Old South Head Road and Military Road (Eastbound)
  • Blake Street Between Military Road and Portland Street (Westbound)
  • Gilbert Street Between Victory Street and Dover Road (Southbound)
  • Hunter Street 2 From Military Road
  • Military Road 1 Between Blake Street and Lancaster Road
  • Myuna Road 2 From Military Road
  • Weonga Road 2 From Military Road

Notes:

1. Buses excepted

2. Access for residents may by maintained at the Military Road closure until 8pm by providing proof or residence and at the discretion of Police. After 8pm, full road closure will be in place

FROM 6PM TO 7:30PM 31 DECEMBER 2021

  • Portland Street Between Dover Road and Lancaster Road (Northbound)
  • Portland Street Between Lancaster Road and Blake Street (Southbound)

FROM 7PM 31 DECEMBER 2021 to 2AM 1 JANUARY 2022

  • Blake Street Between Gilbert Street and Portland Street
  • Victory Street Between Gilbert Street and Portland Street

Clearways are in place on both sides of the road unless stated otherwise.

properties.headline: NYE in Darling Point - Friday 31 December - DARLING POINT various roads inc New Beach Road, Darling Point Road and Loftus Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip or check for service changes.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: NYE road closure and clearways map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: NYE road closure and clearways map

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures, clearways and restricted access will be in place as large crowds celebrate New Year’s Eve (NYE) in Darling Point.

Roads into Darling Point peninsula from New South Head Rd will close from 3pm including New Beach Rd and Loftus St. From 6pm, Yarranabbe Rd, Mona Rd, Greenoaks Ave and other local roads will close. 

Roads reopen from 2am New Year's Day (NYD) or once crowds have cleared however motorists should expect heavy traffic leaving the area after the midnight fireworks and should travel later to avoid the peak traffic.

Special event clearways will be in effect on sections of New Beach Rd from 8am NYE until 2am NYD.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Motorists are reminded that access into various Eastern Suburb peninsulas will be restricted to local residents only from 3pm. Some areas access is restricted to all vehicle traffic after such time.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip or check for service changes.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: NYE road closures and special event clearways
arrangementAttachments.linkName: NYE road closures and special event clearways

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and restricted access arrangements will be in place as large crowds are expected to attend New Year’s Eve celebrations at Rose Bay and Vaucluse.

Roads into Rose Bay from New South Head Rd will close from 3pm including Bayview Hill Rd, Caledonian Rd, Tivoli Ave and other local roads. 

Roads in Vaucluse off New South Head Rd and Old South Head Rd will close from 3pm including sections of Hopetoun Ave, Serpentine Pde, Vaucluse Rd and other local roads.

Roads in both areas reopen from 2am or once crowds have cleared however motorists should expect heavy traffic leaving the area after the midnight fireworks and should travel later to avoid the peak traffic.

Motorists are reminded that access into various Eastern Suburb peninsulas will be restricted to local residents only from 3pm, in some areas access is restricted to all vehicle traffic including residents after such time.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location. Clearways are in place on both sides of the road unless stated otherwise.

webLinks.linkText: Sydney Fish Markets Christmas Trading info and map

properties.headline: Fish Markets Christmas Trading  - Thursday 23 and Friday 24 December - PYRMONT Pyrmont Bridge Road and Bridge Road approaching Sydney Fish Markets
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sydney Fish Market will operate to extended trading hours for the Christmas period from 5am Thursday 23 December until 5pm on Christmas Eve Friday 24 December.

Delays are expected on the Western Distributor approaching the Pyrmont and Glebe off-ramps as well as on local roads in the area. Motorists are advised to allow plenty of extra travel time as parking will be in very high demand.

Parking is available at Sydney Fish Market car park and also nearby at Sydney Secondary College on Pyrmont Bridge Rd.

Pedestrian access to the markets will be via the corner of Bank St and Pyrmont Bridge Rd, Pyrmont Bridge Rd near Wattle St and opposite the Fish Market Light Rail stop on Bank St.
properties.displayName: Fish Markets Christmas Trading  - Thursday 23 and Friday 24 December

roads.mainStreet: Pyrmont Bridge Road and Bridge Road

properties.headline: NYE in Watsons Bay - Friday 31 December - WATSONS BAY Old South Head Road at New South Head Road
properties.publicTransport: Buses will divert during road closures. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip or check for service changes.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: NYE road closure and special event clearways map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: NYE road closure and special event clearways map

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures, clearways and restricted access arrangements will be in place as large crowds are expected to attend New Year’s Eve celebrations (NYE) in Watsons Bay.

Sections of Marine Pde and Robertson Pl may close from 3pm NYE. Roads reopen from 2am New Year's Day (NYD) or once crowds have cleared however motorists should expect heavy traffic leaving the area after the midnight fireworks and should travel later to avoid the peak traffic.

Special event clearways will be in place on sections of Old South Head Rd and Military Rd from 2pm NYE until 2am NYD. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Motorists are reminded that access into various Eastern Suburb peninsulas will be restricted to local residents only from 3pm. In some areas, access is restricted to all vehicle traffic including residents after such time.

arrangementElements.html:
WATSONS BAY - FROM 3PM 31 DECEMBER 2021 TO 2AM 1 JANUARY 2022

  • Marine Parade* between Robertson Place and end of street      
  • Robertson Place* between Hopetoun Avenue and Marine Parade
  • Robertson Place* between Old South Head Rd and Clovelly Lane

Notes: *Subject to road closures by NSW Police at their discretion
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your car is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

WATSONS BAY - FROM 2PM 31 DECEMBER 2021 TO 2AM 1 JANUARY 2022

  • Military Road between Robertson Place and bus turning circle north of Gap Road         
  • Old South Head Road between Robertson Place and Salisbury Street (eastern side)

properties.headline: NYE in Point Piper - Friday 31 December - POINT PIPER New South Head Road at St Mervyns Avenue, Wolseley Road and Wunulla Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip or check for service changes.

arrangementAttachments.linkName: NewYearsEveDec2021EasternSuburbs_A3P v4.pdf

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and restricted access arrangements will be in place as large crowds are expected to attend New Year’s Eve (NYE) celebrations at Point Piper.

Roads into Point Piper from New South Head Rd may close from 3pm NYE including Wolseley Rd, St Mervyns Ave and Wunulla Rd.

Roads reopen from 2am New Year's Day or once crowds have cleared however motorists should expect heavy traffic leaving the area after the midnight fireworks and should travel later to avoid the peak traffic.

Motorists are reminded that access into various Eastern Suburb peninsulas will be restricted to local residents only from 3pm, in some areas access is restricted to all vehicle traffic including residents after such time.

arrangementElements.html:
POINT PIPER - 3PM 31 DECEMBER 2021 TO 2AM 1 JANUARY 2022

  • St Mervyns Avenue* between New South Head Road and end of the road    
  • Wolseley Road* between New South Head Road and Buckhurst Avenue
  • Wunulla Road* between New South Head Road and Wyuna Road  

Notes: * Subject to road closure by NSW Police at their discretion

properties.headline: NYE in Hunters Hill - Friday 31 December - HUNTERS HILL various roads inc Burns Bay Road and Church Street
properties.publicTransport: Buses will not continue to Woolwich after 11am due to road closures. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip or check for service changes.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: NYE road closures and special event clearways map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: NYE road closures and special event clearways map

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures, lane closures, clearways and restricted access arrangements will be place this New Year's Eve (NYE) in Hunters Hill and Woolwich.

The Hunters Hill/Woolwich Peninsula will be closed at the Church St and Reiby Rd intersection from 11am NYE until 2am New Year's Day (NYD). After 11am, access will be maintained for residents and authorised passholders only. From 11:30pm NYE until 1:30am NYD the Burns Bay off-ramp to Church St will also close. 

Special event clearways will be in effect from 12pm midday NYE to 2am NYD on various roads including sections of The Avenue, Church St, Victoria Rd, Burns Bay Rd off-ramp, Alexandra St, Woolwich Rd and other local roads.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:

  • Reiby Road* From Church Street (Eastbound)
  • The Avenue* From Reiby Road

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and changed access arrangements will be in place in Greenwich this New Year’s Eve.

Road closures will in place from 6pm NYE until 1am on sections of Albert St, George St and Gother Ave. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time.

properties.headline: Race Day - Saturday 18 December - RANDWICK Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street approaching Royal Randwick Racecourse
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Villiers Stakes Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse. Gates open from 11.45pm, First race from 12.40pm and last race from 6.20pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as event goers travel to and from the races. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.headline: NBL - Sunday 18 December - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road approaching Qudos Bank Arena
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Sydney Kings v SE Melbourne Phoenix at Qudos Bank Arena from 5.30pm until around 7.40pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd as fans travel to the event.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as fans travel to and from the game.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.headline: A-League - Saturday 18 December - GOSFORD Dane Drive between Central Coast Highway AND Donnison Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Central Coast Mariners v Western Sydney Wanderers at Central Coast Stadium, Gosford from 5.05pm. Full time approx 6.55pm.

Dane Dr will be closed between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St from 3pm and will reopen after the game.

properties.headline: Soccer Match - Sunday 19 December - LEUMEAH Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive approaching Campbelltown Sports Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Macarthur FC v Newcastle Jets at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick off from 4.05pm, full time around 6:05pm approx.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to the stadium.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.headline: A-League - Sunday 19 December - KOGARAH Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street at Princes Highway
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Double Header: Sydney FC v Wellington Phoenix at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium. Kick off women from 4.05pm, Kick off men from 6.45pm and full-time 9pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Local roads around the stadium will close before the game including Jubilee Ave, Park St and English St. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street

properties.headline: NYE in the Balmain Peninsula - Friday 31 December - BALMAIN, ROZELLE AND BIRCHGROVE Victoria Road at Darling Street, Evans Street, McKell Street and Wharf Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip or check for service changes.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: NYE road closures and special event clearways map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: NYE road closures and special event clearways map

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures, clearways and restricted access arrangements will be in place this New Year’s Eve (NYE) in Balmain, Rozelle, Birchgrove and Drummoyne in the Balmain Peninsula.

From 3pm roads into Balmain East & Birchgrove off Victoria Rd will close including sections of Darling St, Evans St, McKell St, Wharf Rd and other local roads. 

There will be no access for general traffic from Victoria Rd into the Balmain Peninsula after 3pm. Access will be maintained for residents on select roads with passes, buses, taxis (until 7pm) and other authorised vehicles only.

Roads will reopen from 12:30am on New Year's Day (NYD) or at the direction of NSW Police when safe to do so. Traffic may be heavy exiting the area so be patient or delay your travel.

Special event clearways will be in effect on Victoria Rd between The City West Link and Westbourne St (western side) from 3pm NYE until 2am NYD.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location. Clearways are in place on both sides of the road unless stated otherwise.

ROZELLE/DRUMMOYNE 

FROM 3PM THURSDAY 31 DECEMBER 2021 TO 2AM FRIDAY 1 JANUARY 2022

  • Victoria Road between City West Link Road and Westbourne Street (western side)

properties.headline: NYE at Taronga Zoo - Friday 31 December - MOSMAN Athol Wharf Road - Bradleys Head Road
properties.publicTransport: Ferries will not be running on Sydney Harbour. Shuttle buses running between the Zoo and Spit Junction. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip or check for service changes.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: NYE road closure and special event clearways map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: NYE road closure and special event clearways map

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and clearways will be in place in Mosman for New Year’s Eve (NYE) at Taronga Zoo.

Bradleys Head Rd and Athol Wharf Rd approaching the Zoo will be closed from 3pm on NYE until 2am New Year's Day (NYD).

Special event clearways will be in effect from 1pm NYE until 3am NYD on sections of Athol Wharf Rd, Bradley Head Rd and Whiting Beach Rd. Clearways will also be in place on sections of Spit Rd from 3pm NYE to 3am NYD, and sections of Military Rd from 6pm NYE to 3am NYD.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
FROM 3PM 31 DECEMBER 2021 TO 2AM 1 JANUARY 2022

  • Bradleys Head Road* between Whiting beach Road and Athol Wharf Road         

Notes:

* Buses excepted. Vehicles within road closure areas will be restricted from exiting prior to reopening.

properties.displayName: NYE at Taronga Zoo - Friday 31 December

properties.headline: Music Festival - Saturday 18 December - NEWCASTLE EAST Wharf Road between Watt Street AND Nobbys Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Lunar Electric is taking place at Camp Shortland, Newcastle East from 12pm to 10pm on Saturday 18 December.

Traffic will be heavy around Newcastle East and motorists should be aware of increased pedestrian and traffic movement in the area.

properties.headline: Christmas Market - Friday 17 to Monday 20 December - CIRCULAR QUAY AND THE ROCKS Alfred St, George St, Argyle St
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip on public transport.
properties.adviceB: Allow extra travel time; Use public transport
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Bastille French Christmas Market with events running from daily from 10am from Friday 17 - Monday 20 December.

The festival will be held at various locations around Circular Quay including Customs House on Alfred St, First Fleet Park off George St, outside the Museum of Contemporary Art, the Overseas Passenger Terminal in Circular Quay West and Argyle St in The Rocks.

No road closures will be in place for the event but motorists should exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads in the area throughout the festival.
properties.displayName: Christmas Market - Friday 17 to Monday 20 December

roads.mainStreet: Alfred St, George St, Argyle St

properties.headline: Christmas market - Friday 17 December - TUMBARUMBA The Parade between Albury Street AND Selwyn Street
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Tumbarumba Christmas Carnival from 5pm until 9pm on Friday 17 December. 

To accommodate the event The Parade (Batlow Rd) will be closed between Albury St and Selwyn St from 3pm to 11:30pm. 

Motorists can detour around the closure via Lauder St, Mate St and Albury St. Heavy vehicles can detour around the closures using the Rosewood to Greenhills access roads via Broadleaf Park Rd and Wondalga Rd. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on-site.

properties.headline: Christmas event - Thursday 23 December - KYOGLE Summerland Way between Wyangarie Street AND Kyogle Road
properties.otherAdvice:
The annual Kygole Street Christmas Party will be taking place on Summerland Way from 4pm.

To accommodate the event Summerland Way will be closed between Kyogle Rd and Wyangarie St from 2:30pm to 10:30pm. 

A detour will be in place via Anzac Dr, Ettrick St and Wyangarie St. Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time and follow the instruction of traffic control onsite.

properties.headline: Flemington Christmas Markets - Saturday 18 December - HOMEBUSH WEST Parramatta Road at Sydney Markets, Homebush
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures may be in place for the Sydney Markets Flemington Christmas trading from 6:30am until 2pm on sections of Flemington Rd/Plaza Rd, Austin Ave and the Loop Rd under Centenary Drive in Homebush West.

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual so allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site.

Motorists travelling from the West and the North can access the markets via the Kerrish Ave entrance. Motorists travelling form the East and the South should use the Potts St entrance.

arrangementElements.html:
HOMEBUSH WEST 

FROM 6:30AM TO 2PM

  • Loop Road* under Centenary Drive between Marlborough Road and Parramatta Road (eastbound)

Notes: *Subject to NSW Police Discretion

properties.headline: NYE event - Friday 31 December - NORTH WOLLONGONG Flinders Street (Princes Highway) between Ajax Avenue AND Bourke Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip on public transport.
properties.otherAdvice:
New Year's Eve (NYE) celebrations will be taking place at The North Gong Hotel from 5:30pm until late.

One southbound lane on Flinders St/Princes Hwy will be closed between Ajax Ave and Bourke St from 5pm NYE until 2:30am New Year's Day (NYD) to accommodate crowds and vehicle drop offs. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time, be aware of changed traffic conditions along the Princes Hwy and exercise caution as there will be increased pedestrian activity on surrounding roads.

properties.headline: NYE event - Friday 31 December - WOLLONGONG Market Street between Keira Street AND Richardson Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip on public transport.
properties.otherAdvice:
New Year's Eve (NYE) celebrations will be taking place at The Illawarra Hotel from 6pm until late.

Market Street will be closed between Keira St and Richardson St from 6pm NYE until 3am New Year's Day (NYD) to accommodate the event. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and exercise caution as there will be increased pedestrian activity on surrounding roads.

properties.headline: NYE in Ulladulla - Friday 31 December - ULLADULLA Princes Highway between Green Street AND Church Street
properties.otherAdvice:
New Year's Eve (NYE) celebrations will be taking place at the Ulladulla Harbour Foreshore from early evening until 10pm.

The Princes Hwy will be closed in both directions between Green St and Church St from 6:30pm to 10pm on NYE. Motorists on the Princes Hwy will be detoured via St Vincents St and Parson St.

Motorists travelling in the area should allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control on site and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.headline: ELEVATE Sydney - SYDNEY Cahill Expressway from Domain Tunnel

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Cahill Expressway closure & clearways map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Cahill Expressway closure & clearways map

properties.otherAdvice:
The Cahill Expressway northbound lanes from the Domain Tunnel to the Sydney Harbour Bridge will be closed from 10pm Thursday 30 December 2021 to 4am Friday 7 January 2022 for Sydney New Year’s Eve and ELEVATE Sydney on the Circular Quay Overpass.

Northbound lanes will also close overnight on Tuesday 28 December between 10pm and 5am to allow for event set up.

Lane 4 on the Sydney Harbour Bridge will close each night from 9.30pm to 10.30pm from 1 - 5 January while the ELEVATE Sydney Sky Show takes place.

Southbound lanes of the Cahill Expressway will also be closed between 9pm 26 December and 4.30am 10 January for roadwork.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Harbour Tunnel during the closure period so allow extra travel time.
properties.diversions: Sydney Harbour Tunnel or Sydney CBD via Macquarie St, Bridge St and Grosvenor St to rejoin the Sydney Harbour Bridge.

properties.headline: Carols in the Domain - Saturday 18 December - SYDNEY Art Gallery Rd at The Domain
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Carols in the Domain, gates open from 1pm and the event finishes 11pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Macquarie St, College St, William St and Art Gallery Rd approaching the Domain as crowds travel to the event so allow extra travel time. If you are planning on driving, arrive early as parking will be in high demand.

Art Gallery Rd will be closed to inbound traffic from 8pm to 11.30pm. Vehicles will be able to exit when safe to do so until the event finishes.

NSW Police may close roads outside The Domain from 9.30pm to allow crowds to safely leave the area after the event including:

  • Macquarie St between Hunter St and St James Rd.
  • St James Rd between Elizabeth St and Macquarie St
  • Princes Albert Rd between Macquarie St and Hospital Rd
  • St Marys Rd between Princes Albert Rd and Sir John Young Crescent
  • College St between Princes Albert Rd and William St
properties.displayName: Carols in the Domain - Saturday 18 December

properties.headline: Police operation - Wednesday 15 December - SYDNEY CBD Druitt Street at Town Hall
properties.publicTransport: Check transportnsw.info service alerts for details.
properties.adviceB: Avoid the area; Use an alternative route
properties.otherAdvice:
From 9am until 12pm one westbound lane on Druitt St will be closed from George St to Clarence St for a State Funeral at Town Hall. 

Motorists should avoid the area and use Market St or Liverpool St instead during this time to avoid delays.

Follow the directions of NSW Police on site.

properties.headline: A-League - Sunday 12 December - GOSFORD Dane Drive between Central Coast Highway AND Donnison Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Central Coast Mariners v Sydney FC at Central Coast Stadium, Gosford from 6.15pm. Full time approx 8:05pm.

Dane Dr will be closed between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St from 3:45pm and will reopen after the game.

properties.headline: Special Events - Friday 10 to Sunday 12 December - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Hill Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A number of events will be held at Sydney Olympic over the weekend:

  • Sunday 12 Dec - BBL: Sydney Thunder v Melbourne Stars at Sydney Showground Stadium from 7.15pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Silverwater Rd, Hill Rd, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd as attendees travel to and from the events over the weekend. 

Pre-book parking at Sydney Olympic Park online to secure a space, available by 11.59pm the night before.
